t: Jeremiah 15
The Lord Will Not Relent
Then*p the Lord*s said to me, “Though Moses and Samuel stood before me, yet my heart would not turn toward this people. Send them out of my sight, and let them go!

And when they ask you, ‘Where shall we go?’ you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord:*s “‘Those*pn who are for pestilence, to pestilence, and*ld those who are for the sword, to the sword; those*ln who are for famine, to famine, and*ld those who are for captivity, to captivity.’
I*p will appoint over them four kinds of destroyers, declares the Lord:*s the sword to kill, the dogs to tear, and the birds of the air and the beasts of the earth to devour and destroy.
And I will make them a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth because of what Manasseh the son of Hezekiah, king of Judah, did in Jerusalem.
“Who*pn will have pity on you, O Jerusalem, or*ld who will grieve for you? Who*ln will turn aside to*ld ask about your welfare?
You*ln have rejected me, declares the Lord;*s you*ld keep going backward, so*ln I have stretched out my hand against you and destroyed you— I*ld am weary of relenting.
I*ln have winnowed them with a winnowing fork in*ld the gates of the land; I*ln have bereaved them; I have destroyed my people; they*ld did not turn from their ways.

I*ln have made their widows more in number than*ld the sand of the seas; I*ln have brought against the mothers of young men a*ld destroyer at noonday; I*ln have made anguish and terror fall*ld upon them suddenly.

She*ln who bore seven has grown feeble; she*ld has fainted away; her*ln sun went down while it was yet day; she*ld has been shamed and disgraced. And*ln the rest of them I will give to the sword before*ld their enemies, declares*l the Lord.”*s
Jeremiah’s Complaint
Woe*p is me, my mother, that you bore me, a man of strife and contention to the whole land! I have not lent, nor have I borrowed, yet all of them curse me.
The Lord*s said, “Have I not set you free for their good? Have I not pleaded for you before the enemy in the time of trouble and in the time of distress?
Can one break iron, iron from the north, and bronze?
“Your*p wealth and your treasures I will give as spoil, without price, for all your sins, throughout all your territory.
I will make you serve your enemies in a land that you do not know, for in my anger a fire is kindled that shall burn forever.”
O*pn Lord,*s you know; remember*ld me and visit me, and*ld take vengeance for me on my persecutors. In*ln your forbearance take me not away; know*ld that for your sake I bear reproach.
Your*ln words were found, and I ate them, and*ld your words became to me a joy and*ld the delight of my heart, for*ln I am called by your name, O*ld Lord,*s God of hosts.
I*ln did not sit in the company of revelers, nor*ld did I rejoice; I*ln sat alone, because your hand was upon me, for*ld you had filled me with indignation.
Why*ln is my pain unceasing, my*ld wound incurable, refusing*ld to be healed? Will*ln you be to me like a deceitful brook, like*ld waters that fail?

Therefore*pn thus says the Lord:*s “If*ln you return, I will restore you, and*ld you shall stand before me. If*ln you utter what is precious, and not what is worthless, you*ld shall be as my mouth. They*ln shall turn to you, but*ld you shall not turn to them.

And*ln I will make you to this people a*ld fortified wall of bronze; they*ln will fight against you, but*ld they shall not prevail over you, for*ln I am with you to*ld save you and deliver you, declares*l the Lord.*s
I*ln will deliver you out of the hand of the wicked, and*ld redeem you from the grasp of the ruthless.”
